ovdesc.p: This application holds company/user wide parameters for the configuration of the valuation output of T24 wealth management.

desc.p: Not Supported in T24 Browser

Sort order for the SUB.ASSET.TYPE. Can be Ascending, Descending or New List. If set to New List the field Sub Asset Type will be inputable and will allow the user to specify how he wants the list to be set.
When application is inputted in APPLICATION field .This field accepts fields of corrsponding application from SS.
Forex creates two entries in SC.VALUATION.EXTRACT (One for the Asset side and one for the Liability side). Should you want to see just the valuated part then you have to specify 1leg.
The option 2leg will show both legs of the forex transaction.
Lets you define a group of Asset as we do not show valuation on an Asset / Currency basis but as a Group of Asset / Currency.
The following associated Multi-Value fields provide the information required to create the group:
GRP.DESC : Group description (Label used in VBFE instead of the Asset Type description.
ASSET.NO : Asset Type to be included in this group
Any T24 field from the T24 file used by the version or enquiry

After setting up your groups of asset types and the drilldown related to them you have to specify for each drilldown the parameters to be used. This field identifies the enquiry and must contain one of the mnemonic used in one of the groups.
Will contain English for the SYSTEM record and the user language for any other ID.
Name of the version (if a version is used for this mnemonic)
Any T24 operand
Only active if Disp Currency set to New List. User can specify the order in which they want the list members to appear.
The value of this field is any record id of AM.VIEW application.
Can be a VB variable (some fields will be available from the VBFE to be used in the drilldown to link to these versions/enquiries)
Not Supported in T24 Browser
For each group of asset type you are able to specify drilldown to T24 application (version. Enquiry, report or script).
This field sets the mnemonic for this drilldown. (MNE1 for example), and will allow enquiries or versions to be used
Defines the seperator to be used in generating hierarchical keys in the valuation workfile.

Time in seconds within which Valuation will not be recalculated for the same enquiry when refreshed or repeated. If ONLINE.YNO set to 'Y' for an enquiry or enquiries in a composite screen, and valuations are requested by the enquiry(ies) using the same parameters within the VAL.EXPIRY period, revaluation will not occur, however, outside that period revaluation will occur.
If set to 'YES', valuation of open limit orders will be at limit price instead of at market price.
The default setting of this field is blank, in which case valuation of all open orders is at market price.

Specifies field within AM.VAL.EXTRACT.WRK which contains the id for the drilldown application version in the field VER.FUNCTION. Alternatively specifies API prefaced with '@' symbol which returns this id.
Field Name or I-descriptor in AM.VAL.PARAMETER or API in F.PGM.FILE prefaced with '@' symbol.
Sub-valued set of BROWSER.TOOLS to add the corresponding ENQUIRY in FRWK.ENQ.
Multi-valued set of T24 ENQUIRYs' which will have BROWSER.TOOLS added to their headers via the FRWK.TOOL field.
Only active if Disp Subasset Type set to New List. User can specify the order in which they want the list members to appear

Sort order for the Currency. Can be Ascending, Descending, Ascending Amount, Descending Amount or New List. If set to New List the field Currency will be inputable and will allow the user to specify how he wants the list to be set.
Defines the default segmentation scheme to use when selected in an online valation request.
Function for the version. (any T24 function i.e I, S, etc..)
It takes value from SUB.ASSET.TYPe table.
Sort order for the ASSET.TYPE. Can be Ascending, Descending or New List. If set to New List the field ASSET.TYPE will be inputable and will allow the user to specify how he wants the list to be set.
This is the drilldown label that will be used in the VBFE application to build the drilldown menu for this group of asset types.
Defines the default hierarchy scheme to use when selected in an online valation request.
T24 application called by the drilldown function.This works in the same way as if you typed it in at the command line, e.g. ENQ %ACCOUNT or ACCOUNT, or SPT VB.CALL
Group description, label used in VBFE instead of the Asset Type description.
Free text to provide a short description of the Group indicated in the field GRP.CODE.

The VBFE valuation is split into three parts. Assets, Liabilities (LD for example) and a third category where you can have all the asset types that are not classified as one of the other 2. e.g. envelopes in safe custody, etc. By setting this field to Y this group of asset will be shown in the third part of the valuation. If this is set to N then these assets will not be shown in the valuation.
Name of the enquiry (if an enquiry is used for this mnemonic)
The ID key of this file is either SYSTEM or any T24 user (i.e an ID from the USER table).
Validation Rules:.Accepts valid APPLICATION name.
Asset Type to be included in this group that can be selected from drop down list. Additional sub values can be added to generate a group of different types of instruments under one identifier.
Only active if Disp Asset Type set to New List. User can specify the order in which they want the list members to appear.
